edu.cmu.cs.cs214.hw5.core

Class QueryableSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.cs.cs214.hw5.core.QueryableSet

  • public class QueryableSet
extends java.lang.Object
    Library class for visualisation plugins that implements custom data structures to enhance querying for data that is "nearby" other Geo-Tagged data. This is meant for visualisation plugins to gain additional information about the source data and implement a flexible range of plug-ins.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • querySet

        public double querySet(int x,
                       int y,
                       int t,
                       java.lang.String attribute)
        Method to query the dataset for a point. Given a spatial (geo-tag) location and an attribute to look for, this method returns it's best guess (given the source data) at what the attribute value would be at this geographical point, regardless of the presence of this point in the actual set. This is useful when trying to generate a uniform map-like visualisation from a source set that contains only random or sparse data.
        Parameters:
        x - location coordinate to interpolate at
        y - location coordinate to interpolate at
        t - location coordinate to interpolate at
        attribute - to get the value of
        Returns:
        interpolated attribute value for this point.

      • getAttributes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAttributes()
        Fetches all of the attributes currently contained within any of the points in the set. Not all points are guaranteed to have all attributes, but at least one point will have each attribute.
        Returns:
        set of attribute names

      • getAttributeGroup

        public java.util.List<DataPoint> getAttributeGroup(java.lang.String attribute)
        Fetches all of the Data Points that have a specific attribute from the set. This enables the visualisation to tailor to only the data that exists (which is necessary while implementing certain visualisations such as bar graphs and histograms). Each DataPoint contains an interface to extract point-specific information.
        Parameters:
        attribute - to query for
        Returns:
        all DataPoints that have that specific attribute
